page.title: 01AREA SOUTH EAST OF TRANENT
page.content: There are two main roads through this area with several tracks serving the many farmsteads. The area is mainly arable farmland with deciduous woodland and some rough grazing for sheep. There are few indications of former mine and quarry workings and a disused railway line meanders through the area. There are two villages, Ormiston and New Winton. Ormiston, which is the bigger of the two, is an old village with one or two buildings marked for preservation. New Winton consists of a few houses on either side of the main road and telephone boxes. Most of the inhabitants of these villages work on the land or in the mines but newer occupations such as building contractors and coach hire have developed.
